model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should benefit Speaker A in making a next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT. A more helpful MEMORY should have more, richer information related to DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with “1”, “2", or “tie”)

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I would tell about my progress of planning my trip to Sweden.
Speaker B: How is the trip to Sweden going anyways?
Speaker A: I am still in the planning stages, since my cousin lives over there, she is helping me to plan it. Any must sees while I am there?
Speaker B: It really depends! Personally, I love the castles! Visby is probably my favorite spot. 
Speaker A: Okay, I will see if there are any castles near where we will be. Do you have any plans to go back to sweden?
Speaker B: Not in the near future, but I'm hoping to get back next summer. I love hitting up all the local beach spots with my old friends.

MEMORY 1
1. Speaker B mentioned playing tennis and going to church on Sunday, while Speaker A has a cousin in Sweden but has not visited the country yet. This has led Speaker A to consider visiting their cousin in Sweden and start saving money for the trip. As a result, Speaker A and Speaker B are now planning to travel to Sweden together.

2. During a conversation about the differences between Sweden and the US, including coffee breaks, Speaker A realized they have a cousin in Sweden but have not visited the country. This realization sparked the idea of visiting their cousin and the need to save money for the trip. Additionally, Speaker B, who has not visited Sweden for a long time due to the high expenses, suggested checking out the volcanoes in Sweden for a unique experience.

MEMORY 2
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'travel and vacations', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B discuss traveling to Sweden, vacation plans, and recommendations for activities in Sweden.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: It is rewarding but is very difficult work at times. That's why I often need some time to decompress and be active. ### Speaker B: At least it is rewarding. Being active is amazing, I have yet to try playing badminton. ### Speaker A: Because my job is flexible, I have been thinking of taking a second part time job to help save money to travel to Sweden.  ### Speaker B: That's awesome! Its so important to take time off and vacation. I can tell you all the cool spots to check out in Sweden. Maybe we could go together since I miss Sweden so much.. I had so many great memories there. ### Speaker A: Yeah that would be great. What would you recommend first that we do when we get there? ### Speaker B: For a newcomer, I'd recommend checking out the volcanos. Its a bit of a unique outing, but I think they are really beautiful. Do you have any favorite things to do when traveling>? ### Speaker A: Yes, I always like to check out local music and local coffee shops for random conversations. Would you want to do that? ### Speaker B: Same! I'm so glad you said that. Coffee shops are literally my favorite thing in the whole world, and Sweden has some awesome ones. I think growing up there is what sparked my interest in good coffee as well as good chocolates' }
